titleStmt.title: An Encoded Transcription of a Borrower's Card: Mlle Monique de Vigan

msIdentifier.repository: Princeton University. Library. Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections

change.ab: Cards are not strictly in chronological order A card for "Mr. Charles Rogers" is written on the verso of one of Mlle de Vigan's (s10) Tagged "AR" on s1 as a persName since it seems like someone's initials s2: Significantly altered transcription to group together notes in "column" format Is "tauchn." note at the end of "Portrait of the Artist" an edition? A different book? Similar question re: "Pen" and "A" on "Walden" and "Lighthouse" below s3: This is the recto of the card, but should be the verso (should be s4) s4: This should be the recto (should be s3) Removed "unclear" tag, replaced with "Pomes Penyeach" s5: Corrected "Shanghaed" to "Shanghaid" Corrected "Whiteoakds" to "Whiteoaks" Corrected "JAcket" to "Jacket" s7: Corrected "Feb - 49" to "Feb - 47" s9: Corrected "Cevilly" to "Chevilly" s10: Added "unclear" tags around "CRHill" s11: Added "Socialism" within "unclear" tags, word still illegible but possibly is a Bernard Shaw book s12: Corrected "Interium" to "Interim" Corrected "Lead (unclear)" to "Deadlock" s14: Despite the "1941" at the top of card, subscription info context suggests that most dates on the card are in 1940. Corrected "Ross" to "Rossi" Corrected "1946" to "1941" s16: Corrected "Arm." to "Arms." Corrected "Renwed" to "Renewed" Corrected "25th" to "25f" Corrected "Maizie" to "Maisie"
s4: with Madness s4: P s11: Nov 21 Intelligent Woman's Guide to (Socialism?) s12: March 30: Lead s20: July 18 Manhattan Transfer (+?) (Z?)
